responsibilities: Design and implement prototypes multi-media (audio, image, and video) acceleration framework for AI SoC chips
Design and implement prototypes camera system and ISP firmware for AI SoC chips
Design and implement prototypes middleware for AI SoC chips
Contribute to define and design of integrated software-hardware (chipset) solutions for various applications such as robotics, HPC, and automotive
qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for documentation and presentation
Experience with embedded system (arm) Linux kernel or machine learning library implementation
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on designing and implementing prototypes for AI SoC (System on Chip) chips, specifically for multi-media acceleration, camera systems, ISP firmware, and middleware. The responsibilities also include contributing to the definition and design of integrated software-hardware solutions for applications like robotics, HPC, and automotive. The skills required include programming in C++/C/Python, familiarity with the Linux kernel, and experience with embedded systems or machine learning library implementation.

The job description emphasizes hardware and software integration for AI SoC chips, with a focus on multimedia processing and embedded systems. There is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus seems to be more on the hardware and firmware aspects of AI systems rather than on developing or working with GenAI or LLMs, which typically involve natural language processing, text generation, or similar tasks.
